title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5009.6 - Forfeitures
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 5009.6 - Forfeitures

State Regulations

Forfeitures arising under the system for any reason may not
be applied to increase the benefits of any members at any time prior to the
termination of the system within the meaning of section
401(a)(8)
of the Internal

Revenue Code or any successor thereto. In the event of termination of the
system or a complete or permanent discontinuance of contributions thereunder, the rights of members to accrued benefits, to the extent funded, will become
vested to the extent required by, and upon the events set forth in, Treasury

Regulation section 1.401 -6(a)(1) and Internal Revenue Code section 401(a)(4)
and 401(a)(7) as in effect on September 1, 1974. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
5009.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
